Singapore Geospatial Challenge

Business Analytics Mania 2016

NUS University Town | 3 - 4 September

Mapping Our Tomorrow
Singapore Geospatial Challenge Business Analytics Mania (SGCBAM) is a nationwide competition which aims to generate awareness among pre-university and university students on the subject of geospatial analysis and its application to business scenarios. SGCBAM is aligned with the governmentâ€™s latest goal of building up analytics competency, furthering the SG Smart Nation initiatives.


$5000 worth of cash prizes to be won! More details up soon!
Hello

Eligibility

All pre-university students (Junior Colleges, Polytechnics, Millennia Institute) are welcome!

Fees

Absolutely free. Come down to learn with everyone else!

Teams

Form teams of 3 from the same institution to compete! No experience required!

What You Need

Your own laptop is required! Charging ports will be provided.

Format

SGCBAM 2016 is a 2-day (9am - 6pm) competition from 3rd to 4th September 2016, held at UTown, National University of Singapore. Lunch and dinner will be provided.

The Challenge

Teams will be given a set of raw data, and learn to use data analytic tools (SAS) to visualise data and generate business insights based on a problem statement.

Our panel of judges will decide the winner based on the most innovative and thorough use of data. The problem statement for the challenge will be released on the competition day itself.

Check out our Facebook page for hints on the challenge!

What's in it for me?

A first-of-its-kind, this competition is specially catered for students with interest in the growing field of business analytics in the Infocomm industry.

You get to attend talks by industry experts in the field of geospatial and business analytics!

Have fun while you learn during the Amazing Race session where you and your team race against time to complete station games.

Learn
Participants will attend workshops on geospatial, SAS and business analytics to have a clearer overview of geospatial field and its application in businesses.
Play
Participants will be involved in an Amazing Race where they will go to different stations and complete a task. The task execution will cement the things learnt from the workshops.
Apply
Using the knowledge and skills learnt from the workshops and Amazing Race, participants will work in their teams to come up with an analysis of the given dataset and provide solutions to the problem statement.
Prepare Yourself!
Students should install SAS software on their personal laptops before the start of the competition. Further details will be released soon.
Let the countdown begin!
